Posts.Content: Hi Bev, Thanks for cap website info... Hope ypu are ok. Try to take it easy and enjoy life to the fullest. I love wigs, and can change my looks as I please. I may go out au naturel!!! we will see. Take care Cherub43.x
Posts.Title: Wigs

Posts.Content: Hey....I love wearing my wigs when I am out. I have also lost all my hair and have a little head like an almond...well cute. I tend to wear a little head stocking under my wig....can get them in wig shops. Try and see how you get on with them. From Cherub43......Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Wigs

Posts.Content: Hi Girls....Forion, Katrina40, Katie54, Sarah32, Bev51, Oldhat and all the ladies on this forum. Hope that you are all resting and remaining positive. I can say that I am usually full of beans until wednesday this week, I was told that my white cell count was low and have to wait a week. Hopefully, I will have chemo next thursday, followed by a drug 24hrs after chemo to stimulate white cell growth. I was a little tearful yesterday, due only to the fact that my chemo would have to be delayed by a week......ahhhh! I mean girls...can you believe me upset because of having to wait a week...Anyone else would be happy to have a week of chemo...smile!  Anyway, to cheer myself up a little I went to town for a short while untill the legs said....no more walking... I managed to buy a picture frame for a beautiful pic from my sister. I also managed to buy some of those sea bands which are good for nausea during chemo. Girls, you can get them at any chemist. I have also been signed off from work for another 2 months...I will not be thinking about work for a while now until I am fully recovered.... Anyway, Girls have a lovely weekend. I plan to rest, rest, rest....From Cherub43.x
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Girls....Hope you are all hanging in there! Hi Katrina40, It would be good for us women if the national screening went down to age 47.Like you it would not have helped me, as I was 42 when I was diagnosed. Again, mine was found by me feeling a lump and then Doctor checking for me.I am glad of the regular checks post treatment, and hopefully they can keep an eye on what's happening if anything. Katie54, Thanks for sharing your story with us -about you and your husband on holiday. Glad that you got your mammagram 12 months earlier....Thank God. The earlier detection for us the better. Noj, I am glad that your mammagram was clear.I know that it can be sore...but at least you are ok. Chrissi, I am hoping to have my 3rd chemo this week, and I can say that your body adapts to it all. I had lots of side effects after 1st chemo, and then things slowed down a little. I am hoping bloods are ok this thurs for chemo. I too had some indigestion, nausea, mouth ulcers ....the lot. I took lots of natural ginger. My dry hands I used a cream called Aveeno-very good, as is E45 cream. Bev51, I am on FEC also, and I find the Cyclophoshamide affects me the worst......my head aches, I want to sneeze and feel really congested......yuk!! I hope that you enjoyd your tool fair. I am feeling a little isolated as white cells down. I am trying to be extra carefull in case of infection....that's about me for now until I feel a little better in myself. Oldhat, You are right...It is fascinating to read about others. I feel that I am not alone and that gives me strength and courage to fight on even if I feel a little low. Delilah, Hi there...I was diagnosed on the 31st Dec last year. I am waiting for no 3 chemo, had horrible side effects after the 1st one. I think that my body is trying to settle a bit now, but I have a very low white cell count. Hopefully, they will try and boost up cells with an injection of Pegfillgrastim. This injection stimulates growth of white cells. All the best with treatments and try to stay positive. That's all for now girls, and I am sorry if I have forgotten anyone. Much love from Cherub43xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hello Girls,  Hope that you are all well and remaining very positive. Hi to Katie54, Bev51, Katrina40, Wendy Darling, and all the other special ladies out there. I am currently in my Neutrapenic Stage. I am not feeling too....bad.....just a little tired at times. I even went shopping today bought lots of colourful fruit and veg-Anything to encourage eating. I prepared  BBQ Chicken, veg and potatoes...yum. I am hoping to have 3rd chemo on 11th march, and am glad that I have done quite well...The only thing that upsets me is the sickie feeling after chemo, the horrible taste in mouth and tiredness. This only tends to last about 4 to 7 days post chemo, and then I start to pick up a little. Oh, all my hair has gone, but I am still beautiful...smile. I have really pretty wigs to wear and have fun with them. I was always so girlie before my cancer diagnosis with lota of hair and pretty nails, but I know it will all come back once I am better. I am hoping to do so much once I am better, and looking forward to being able to share my experiences with others. I think that I may treat myself to a cruise some time.....and to totally pamper myself for the rest of my life......sounds good...What do you think?? Much love to you all. From Cherub43xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi there, I had my first Chemo on 28th Jan 2010. I had quite a number of side effects, however remained strong and positive throughout. I am feeling a little better. To hopefully have 2nd chemo this thursday. I therefore hope that my white cells are up and that my chemo can be continued on thursday. There are a number of side effects with chemo...who knows...you may be much better with 2nd chemo-be positive.
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hello Everybody, How are you all? I hope keeping strong and positive. It's been so lovely reading all your messages. Such a great feeling to have so much support from lovely people who are going through similar situations to myself. I do not feel alone at all, and in fact I feel more able to accept the physical and emotional changes that ocurr with such an illness. I am due to have blood test tommorow, to see if my white cells are up for my next Chemo which is on thursday. I know that it will be a long journey, but I am to fight this like a lion......laugh! Keep well all. Cherub43.x
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hello all you lovely strong ladies..... Hi to Katrina40, Forion, Bev51, Oldhat, Sarah32, and all the ladies I have not mentioned here. Thank you all for your shared messages. It gives me so much strength to know that I am not alone with my cancer. I am able to find so much help and tips from your messages here on this forum. Thank you all. At first when I was diagnosed with breast cancer..I only thought of the ending, but now I see a light at the end of the tunnel. Some days are good, and some are not so good, But I know it will be ok in the end. I am due to have my 3rd chemo this week if bloods are ok...I will be half way through my chemo...hope I will not be feeling too...poorly post chemo, as I tend to be very sick with nausea. I have heared of something called sea bands-can get them at the chemist to put round your wrist for nausea and sickness. I am also listening to my body girls....If I feel hungry like now I eat. The weight will drop once I am better and the gym and personal trainer will always be there for me to get back my shape.....smile! Anyway, Girls take great care. From Cherub43.xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi there Ladies...Hope you are all keeping up the positive attitudes towards our journey. The last two weeks have been a little difficult for me as I felt quite low and so....so..tired following the 3rd chemo. I am just begining to feel like me again. I really appreciate the messages you all write-they do encourage me to feel much better in myself...Thank You All. Forion-So nice to get support from you girls. Had a bad time with 3rd chemo, but feeling better now. Forion...How did you manage with your cold?? Must have taken lots out of you. Glad you are better, and I am always smilling. Have a good weekend. Cherub43.x Katrina40-How is Radiotherapy going? What will be the next stage for you post radio? All the best to you Kat. From Cherub43.x Katie54- I will be having 4th chemo on 8th April. I agree...nice to have brighter days. Keep well. From Cherub43.x Bev51-I do hope that you find a lovely wig for the wedding. The human hair wigs are ace, and you can even have them cut to suit. Bev....what happens after the 6 fec??Do you know?? I guess I still have a long way to go....smile I have not even had my operation as yet! .... From Cherub43.x Deliah-I am glad that you are feeling well. It is lovely to have support from a partner. Sure right- We are together in this...From Cherub43.x Chrissi-My 3rd chemo hit me quite hard with nausea, tiredness etc....However, it's so nice to know that no 4 is on the way. Take care. From Cherub43.x Chaedlel-You are right about riding it out girl.....Esp when immune is off. I had a bad night last night, kept an eye on my temp which was ok. Thank God. Look after yourself. From Cherub43.x Also, a big hello to all the other lovely ladies on this journey. It is really nice to have so much support here. Keep well and stay happy throughout. From Cherub43.xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!
